meanings.definition: A chemical or physical marker added to materials for identification or tracking purposes.
meanings.sent1: The taggant in the fabric helped the investigators identify the source of the material.
meanings.sent2: The taggant on the package allowed the authorities to track its movement.
meanings.sent3: The detective followed the trail of the taggant, leading him to the hidden stash of goods.
meanings.sent4: The taggant acted as a secret code, revealing the true origin of the product.
meanings.sent5: The bright red taggant stood out against the dull background, making it easy to spot.

meanings.definition: To mark or label with a taggant.
meanings.sent1: She carefully tagganted each item in the inventory to ensure accurate tracking.
meanings.sent2: The security personnel tagganted the boxes before loading them onto the truck.
meanings.sent3: He playfully tagganted his friend's backpack with a sticker as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The artist tagganted her masterpiece with a hidden symbol only she knew.
meanings.sent5: The gardener tagganted each plant with a tiny flag to remember its name.
